intro: Macrachaenium gracile var. radiatum, commonly known as the slender leaved grass, is a variant of the grass species Macrachaenium gracile. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and delicate inflorescences. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its flowering period occurs during the late spring to early summer months. The plant is notable for its fine texture and subtle coloration, making it a desirable addition to ornamental gardens.
